sep.gaia.util

Class FloatBoundingBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.util.FloatBoundingBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundingBox

    public class FloatBoundingBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements BoundingBox
    Class to represent the size of a rectangle by giving the coordinates of the upper left corner and the lower right corner. All used 3d vectors are used for 2-dimensional coordinates and have 0 as their z-coordinate. The coordinates are represented as float values.
    Author:
    Max Witzelsperger, Johannes Bauer, Matthias Fisch

      void setLowerRight(Vector3D lowerRight)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FloatBoundingBox

        public FloatBoundingBox(FloatVector3D upLeft,
                FloatVector3D lowRight)
        Generates a new bounding box with float coordinates. The z-coordinates of all used vectors will be ignored and should be 0. The given coordinates must form a valid rectangle, which is the case if and only if upLeft.getX() < lowRight.getX() and upLeft.getY() > lowRight.getY() are both true. Otherwise those two values will initially be null.
        Parameters:
        upLeft - the coordinates of the upper left corner in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate should be 0 and will otherwise be ignored.
        lowRight - the coordinates of the lower right corner in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate should be 0 and will otherwise be ignored.

      • FloatBoundingBox

        public FloatBoundingBox(FloatVector3D upLeft,
                FloatVector3D upRight,
                FloatVector3D lowLeft,
                FloatVector3D lowRight)
        Initializes the bounding-box with its corners.
        Parameters:
        upLeft - The upper-left corner.
        upRight - The upper-right corner.
        lowLeft - The lower-left corner.
        lowRight - The lower-right corner.

    • Method Detail

      • getUpperLeft

        public FloatVector3D getUpperLeft()
        Description copied from interface: BoundingBox
        Gets the upper left coordinate of this.
        Specified by:
        getUpperLeft in interface BoundingBox
        Returns:
        the upper left coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is 0

      • setUpperLeft

        public void setUpperLeft(Vector3D upperLeft)
        Sets the upper left coordinate if the argument upperLeft together with the current lower right coordinate lowerRight of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight. Otherwise the invocation of this method is without effect. Additionally the parameter upperLeft must be an instance of FloatVector3D, otherwise the new value will not be set.
        Specified by:
        setUpperLeft in interface BoundingBox
        Parameters:
        upperLeft - the new coordinates for the upper left corner of this, which must be an instance of FloatVector3D and of which the z-coordinate is assumed to be 0 and will otherwise be ignored

      • getLowerRight

        public FloatVector3D getLowerRight()
        Description copied from interface: BoundingBox
        Gets the lower right coordinate.
        Specified by:
        getLowerRight in interface BoundingBox
        Returns:
        the lower right coordinate in form of a 3-dimensional vector of which the z-coordinate is 0

      • setLowerRight

        public void setLowerRight(Vector3D lowerRight)
        Sets the lower right coordinate if the argument lowerRight together with the current upper left coordinate upperLeft of this forms a valid rectangle, which it does if and only if the x-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly smaller than the x-coordinate of lowerRight and the y-coordinate of upperLeft is strictly greater than the y-coordinate of lowerRight. Otherwise the invocation of this method is without effect. Additionally the parameter lowerRight must be an instance of FloatVector3D, otherwise the new value will not be set.
        Specified by:
        setLowerRight in interface BoundingBox
        Parameters:
        lowerRight - the new coordinates for the lower right corner of this, which must be an instance of FloatVector3D and of which the z-coordinate is assumed to be 0 and will otherwise be ignored

      • rotate

        public void rotate(FloatVector3D center,
          float rotation)
        Rotates the box clockwise around center. The z-coordinates of the corners is ignored and will stay the same.
        Parameters:
        center - The point to rotate around.
        rotation - The angle of the rotation in degrees.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(FloatBoundingBox box)
        Checks if box is contained in this bounding-box.

        Returns:
        true if box is contained. Otherwise false.

      • scale

        public void scale(float c)
        Scales the bounding-box by factor c assuming that center is its center.
        Parameters:
        center - The assumed center of the Bounding-box.
        c - The factor to scale.
